discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When preparing a program work breakdown structure (WBS), a guiding principle for a program manager is:

D. Decompose the program at a level sufficient to achieve control.

This principle emphasizes the importance of breaking down the program work into manageable components or sections to a level that allows for effective planning, monitoring, and control. The decomposition should be detailed enough to provide clear guidance and oversight for all aspects of the program, yet not so granular that it becomes unwieldy or overly complex. This balance is crucial for effective program management.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer.
D. Decompose the program at a level sufficient to achieve control - the level of decomposition should be enough to manage the program. That is the main principle of PWBS creation

questions.question_text: Which of the following serves as a guiding principle for a program manager when preparing a program work breakdown structure?

choices.A: Decompose the program work based upon available resources
choices.B: Decompose the program to the work package level
choices.C: Decompose the program to the architecture baseline level
choices.D: Decompose the program at a level sufficient to achieve control

questions.question_text:
A software development program will launch iterative versions of new software called Alpha over two years. Following that, a program will be released to the program team and developers to create new software called Beta. While the program manager prepares the program closure plan for Alpha, the program sponsor expresses concern about its support after program closure.
What should the program manager do as part of Alpha's program closure plan?

choices.D: Document the program closure procedure to ensure that resources are released from Alpha to develop Beta.
choices.A: Execute the transition plan, and include knowledge transfer to transition Alpha support to operations.
choices.B: Keep the Alpha program open until support is no longer required, then execute program closure.
choices.C: Adjust Alpha's exit criteria to ensure its support is included in the Beta program.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Execute the transition plan, and include knowledge transfer to transition Alpha support to operations.

This action ensures that the support for the Alpha software continues after the program has officially closed. The transition plan should include handing over responsibilities to the operational team who will support Alpha post-launch. This includes knowledge transfer, so the operational team understands the software and has the necessary information and documentation to maintain and support it effectively.

Selected Answer: A
A is the right answer.
in Normal case, A will be the answer, in this case same team will continue working in developing the software, so same developers will make the support not the Operations

My answer is A. 
B is not the answer for sure as it is not the way to keep program open. 
D is not the answer, as closure procedure not make sure the operation support is going well. 
C I don't think it is the answer,. As Beta is another software. Alpha program is not support by Beta program.

questions.question_text:
An IT program manager is concerned that a program is not achieving its defined incremental benefits due to a lack of delivery by the business team. The IT team has several dependencies on the business team throughout the program. However, the business team does not report to the IT program manager, and only two business team resources with the appropriate skills are available to complete the required program tasks.
To address this issue, what should the IT program manager do next?

choices.A: Schedule a meeting with the business team to discuss transferring the two business team resources to the IT team; update the program risk register to include risk mitigation steps.
choices.C: Review and clarify the business team's program roles and responsibilities; determine the schedule impact on benefits delivery; direct the IT project manager to meet with the business team to ensure dependencies are understood and that the appropriate resources can be made available.
choices.D: Modify the program milestone dates to include a larger contingency; determine the impact on the project implementation date; update the benefits management plan.
choices.B: Escalate the lack of commitment by the business team to the program steering committee; hire a new project resource to complete the required tasks; update the program risk register to include risk mitigation steps.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the right answer.

questions.question_text:
A global enterprise resource planning (ERP) program's scope includes designing and building a global template. Plans include a pilot implementation project to validate the template, to be followed by several rollout projects. During the build of the global template, a new government regulation mandates implementation of a goods and services tax (GST).
What should the program manager update?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In the scenario of a global enterprise resource planning (ERP) program where a new government regulation mandates the implementation of a goods and services tax (GST) during the build of the global template, the program manager should update:

B. Benefits management plan.

The introduction of a new government regulation like the GST could potentially impact the expected benefits of the ERP program. Therefore, the benefits management plan should be reviewed and updated to reflect how this new regulation impacts the programâ€™s benefits. This may include adjustments in financial benefits, operational efficiencies, or compliance-related benefits. The benefits management plan should align with these new regulatory requirements to ensure that the program continues to deliver value in accordance with its objectives, taking into account the changes brought by the GST implementation.

Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer.

A program receives initial approval from the selection committee to proceed with the program development.
What should the program manager do next?

choices.D: Continue to develop the high-level program road map.
choices.C: Analyze lessons learned and historical information to validate the program's expected outcomes.
choices.A: Define the program architecture and assign the benefits realization to the component projects.
choices.B: Complete the program setup to establish a firm foundation of support and approval for the program.
